author: kkolinko
msg: Record-only merge of r1417826,1444292 from 6.0.x/trunk
Those are revisions that have been merged from this branch to trunk.
Thus all those changes are already present in this branch and cannot be merged back.
Updated BRANCH-README.txt

author: kkolinko
msg: Fix https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=54248
Need to reset the decoder when the B2C converter is recycled to ensure BOMs
are correctly handled for those encodings that require them.
Merging r1444289 from tomcat6-testing branch.
It is backport of r1430083 from 7.0.x

author: julianfoad
msg: Extend the test that checks a merge aborts in the right way when conflicts
are raised.
The reason for being so thorough with this particular test is because I am
currently refactoring the way the merge handles a conflict, so I want good
test coverage.
(The new helper functions at the beginning of this patch are here placed
just before the test itself, but could better be moved to somewhere more
generally accessible.  The new expected_merge_output2() should probably be
combined with the existing expected_merge_output().)
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(parse_changes_list, parse_rev_args,
RangeList, expected_merge_output2, expected_out_and_err,
check_mergeinfo, simple_merge): New functions.
(conflict_aborted_mergeinfo_described): Test many more combinations:
merges that raise a conflict during the first or last sub-range of the
first or last specified range; both forward and reverse merges.

author: kkolinko
msg: Followup - testcase part of the following:
Fix https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=54248
Need to reset the decoder when the B2C converter is recycled to ensure BOMs
are correctly handled for those encodings that require them.
Backport of r1430083 from 7.0.x
